feedback: Fix the CSS token typo: --elev: #fffff is invalid (missing a hex digit). Correct tokens and verify both light/dark palettes compile and meet contrast targets.

Ensure the nav is actually sticky: add position: sticky; top: 0; z-index; and verify it remains visible on scroll on mobile and desktop (include a small shadow/elevation for contrast against content).

Confirm smooth scrolling respects prefers-reduced-motion: only invoke behavior: 'smooth' when not reduced; prefer CSS scroll-behavior where appropriate and fall back in JS with the same preference check.

Make FAQ accordion fully accessible: each question button must have aria-expanded (true/false) and aria-controls linking to a panel id; each panel should have role='region' and aria-labelledby. Implement Enter/Space keyboard toggling in JS and ensure focus order is preserved.

Improve contact form accessibility & validation UX: associate labels with inputs, use required and type='email' attributes, add an aria-live="polite" region for friendly JS validation messages, and ensure JS only augments (does not replace) browser validation; prevent submit only when invalid.
Reserve image/SVG space to avoid CLS: give hero illustration and any large images explicit width/height or an aspect-ratio box so layout doesn't shift as assets load.
Visible focus styles: ensure :focus-visible outlines for all interactive elements (links, buttons, form controls) and test keyboard-only navigation to verify focus is always visible.
Verify color contrast ratios programmatically (>=4.5:1 body text): include brief note in README which color tokens pass and update any tokens that fail in dark mode.
Load JS non-blocking (use defer) and remove any synchronous/blocking operations; run the page and fix any console errors/warnings.

Add or update README notes listing any known limitations, confirmation that cross-browser checks were performed (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge), and brief instructions to open index.html locally. If any acceptance criteria remain unmet, list them explicitly.

headings.text: Close the loop with LoopPilot. Ship what matters.

buttons.text: How does the free trial work?
Do you support SSO and role permissions?
Do you offer discounts for nonprofits?
